channel.title: Presentations on Openness & Sensitivity: Practical Concerns In Taking Archaeological Data Online
channel.description: Recent content in Presentations on Openness & Sensitivity: Practical Concerns In Taking Archaeological Data Online

item.title: Negotiating Complexity in the Management of Sensitive Digital Data
item.description: David Gadsby National Park Service Appropriate stewardship of sensitive archeological data necessarily involves overlapping and intertwined authorities, systems, and institutions. The authorities, in turn have different limits and requirements, while various entities have divergent purposes, needs, and protocols. Archeologists, librarians, data managers, planners, and resource managers who work with sensitive data require a thorough understanding of the nature of both the physical and digital resources and the contexts in which they are embedded.
